channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Israeli Hospital Strike Kills 20 in Gaza, Including 5 Journalists
item.description: Five journalists, as well as medical workers, were among the dead at Nasser Hospital, where a second strike hit as ambulance crews were arriving. Prim...

item.title: Trump is bringing in enough revenue from tariffs to cut deficits by $4 trillion over the next decade, CBO says
item.description: In just two months, Trump added another $1.5 trillion of deficit reduction in the form of new tariffs, CBO said. Still, the One Big Beautiful Bill Act...

item.title: Trump’s tariffs are becoming such an important revenue source that they’re now propping up America’s debt rating
item.description: "At this time, it appears that meaningful tariff revenue has the potential to offset the deficit-raising aspects of the recent budget legislation."

item.title: Small medical firm plans $400 million Solana purchase as crypto treasury trend spreads
item.description: But Multicoin Capital, Galaxy Digital, and Jump Crypto are reportedly in the market to raise another $1 billion for their own Solana treasury company.

item.title: Millions of Gen Zers are jobless—and unemployment is mainly affecting men
item.description: Young men ages 20 to 24 have faced higher unemployment rates since the thick of the COVID-19 pandemic as Gen Z women funnel into AI-proof jobs like he...

item.title: Trump Orders Major Expansion of National Guard’s Role in Law Enforcement
item.description: An executive order released on Monday directs the creation of specialized Guard units to quell civil disturbances in each state and seeks civilian vol...

item.title: The emperor strikes back—but Trump’s revenge and deflection aren’t public protection
item.description: Over 2,000 years ago, Roman emperors would arrange massive public salutes to themselves, surrounded by armed, uniformed soldiers and cheering crowds.

item.title: Abrego Garcia Detained Again After Administration Signaled It Would Re-Deport Him
item.description: A judge in Maryland barred the administration from immediately deporting Kilmar Armando Abrego Garcia until he had a chance to challenge the move.

item.title: A Star in Russia’s Media World Joins Ukraine’s Army
item.description: On the ground in Kharkiv, the choices are starkly different.

item.title: Israel’s Gaza Campaign Is Making It a Pariah State
item.description: Israel is well on its way to making itself a pariah state — to the point that Israelis will think twice about speaking Hebrew when traveling abroad.

item.title: How the Pygmy Sea Horse Lost Its Snout
item.description: The genome of a small, remarkable sea horse offers a surprising lesson in nature’s creativity.
